channel.title: Poitive Rap Messages
channel.description:
Has anyone else noticed the positive messages rappers are starting to portray?
For example:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=crXDdMkD2gQ[/youtube]
If you don't want to listen to it let me outline some key verses.
"What train of thought is tellin’ you shoot up a movie theatre? What kind of fool gon’ walk in a school and off them angels? It could me my moms, my brother or sister, a friend that I knew The funny thing is, it could’ve been me, it could’ve been you"
"I went to them schools and spoke to the children that need it the most I gave away toys, I gave ‘em a speech, delivered ‘em hope It’s a blessing to become a blessing, my mama would set it in stone"
A few others:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gqt2SsDoFNA[/youtube]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-iVQo9RXX6E[/youtube]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hlVBg7_08n0[/youtube]
Even if you don't listen to rap, I would say give the first one a go.
Opinions?

item.title: Poitive Rap Messages
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

This is a topic I’ve been dying to discuss with someone and it’s a bit off the topic you’re looking for but there is relation, in a way. It’s a bit self opinionated but I have mixed feelings about people who sing about the government in America. Yes America have shit politics but people like Hopsin, Immortal Technique, Machine Gun Kelly, Ace Hood are all feeding the Illuminati cause all these teenagers seem to be rambling on about. It’s more of a personal problem with me because I feel that if such a cult still existed then it would be known but all these conspiracy theorist pull the same shit about the 9/11, George Washington bridge terrorist attack etc. I kind of want to relate to these artists as using that type of trend to gain views which it actually does… Same with the media and everything else. To put this into retrospective, what do teenagers seem to love to compare and talk about? Nostalgia, disasters and causes but in a sense that they want to figure out some sort of Da Vinci code. But as usual teenagers need to find something more or less mainstream, so lets go deeper, History, Illuminati, both historical and possibly disastrous. They find one thing and bring it up as a trend which eventually goes mainstream, celebrities, dreamers and big firms see this trend and implement it into their music videos, films, comedy sketches and even games. Celebrities, they seem to be the ones using this most. Rihanna, Beyonce, Justin Beiber, One Direction, they all use this technique to get the teenagers researching and buying their products, this eventually leads to them giving whoever it is the publicity. But please, if you seriously believe in this cult existing and being the cause of 9/11 and every other terrorist attack then do me a favor, I don’t want to argue, I couldn’t really give a fuck about your shit, you can waste all your time researching about something that is as ridiculous as researching whether there is a God or not.

Sorry for the long rant that may or may not be related but it’s a serious topic, seriously annoying topic to find every single place I go.

Read full topic

item.title: Poitive Rap Messages
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Null Amount:

It’s pcool that the last song has been playing on the radio now as well.

That’s how I got on this bandwagon of listening to positive rap, I heard the song on the radio and though “Fuck, hope is being restored.”. I then found more.

Read full topic

item.title: Poitive Rap Messages
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

asyo4:

I’m glad people are starting to wake up. More famous/influential people need to start speaking their mind instead of how much cash they make.

I agree, I think the only way anything will change is to get into the younger generations head through popular media. People need to start loving each other. It sickens me to be honest.

Read full topic
